member.name: T:PICT.NativeMethods
member.summary: Class declares the p/Invoke syntax for PICT usage from .NET consumers.

member.name: M:PICT.NativeMethods.Execute(System.Int32,System.String[],System.Text.StringBuilder,System.Int32)
member.summary: Execute is the entry point to the command-line PICT, and it behaves accordingly. To use it, we need to mimic the runtime's handling of the console apps. The second argument is a path to the model file.
member.param: The number of arguments being passed to PICT
The PICT command-line arguments. The first argument is the name of the program but in this case, the actual value doesn't matter.
Gets set to the output produced by PICT.
member.returns: The Error Code resulting from executing PICT with the command-line .
member.remarks: pict.dll exports this method, make sure you have pict.dll next to this executable when running.
